Text.Text: RECITALS
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 1. BLUE APPLE PROPERTY MANAGEMENT L.L.C. (hereinafter referred to as the "Employer")
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: is the developer of the Al Reem Island Integrated Health Care Center in Abu Dhabi.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 2. The Employer has entered into a Turnkey Design & Construct Contract dated December 22,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 2015 (hereinafter referred to as the "Main Contract") with VAMED ENGINEERING GmbH
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (hereinafter referred to as the "Main Contractor") for the design, construction and equipping
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: of the Al Reem Integrated Health Care Center (hereinafter referred to as the "Project").
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 3. The Main Contractor has engaged the Contractor for the performance of some works within
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the Project.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 4. The Contractor has accepted the Subcontractor's offer for the design (to the extent required
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: by the Subcontract), execution and completion of the Works (and the remedy of any defects
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: therein) on the terms set out in this Subcontract.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: This Subcontract sets out the terms and conditions upon which the Contractor and the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor will perform their respective obligations in relation to the Works.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Affiliate means, in relation to any party, any other party that directly or indirectly controls or is
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: controlled by or is under common control with such party. For the purposes of this definition
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 'control' means that a person possesses, directly or indirectly, the power to direct or cause the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: direction of the management and policies of the other party, whether through the ownership of
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: voting shares, by contract or otherwise, and 'controls' and 'controlled' shall be interpreted
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: accordingly.

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor or cause it to incur additional Costs in order to construct the Works in
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: accordance with the Subcontract, absent such issue.

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) co-ordination between the performance of the Works and other work on or around the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Site by Other Subcontractors and smooth transition and co-operation between the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: account the fast track nature of the Project.

Text.Text: 3.4 Record Retention
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) The Subcontractor shall maintain full and detailed Records as may be necessary for
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the proper execution of the Works under the Subcontract and as required by
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: applicable Laws. Such Records shall be prepared and maintained in accordance with
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: generally accepted accounting principles and, unless a longer period is imposed by
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: applicable Laws, shall be retained from the Signature Date to the date which is seven
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (7) years after:
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (i) the date of the Performance Certificate; or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (ii)
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the date of termination of the Subcontract,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: whichever is earlier (Retention Period).

Text.Text: 3.5 Contractor's Representative's Duties and Authority
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) The Contractor shall appoint a Contractor's Representative who shall carry out the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: duties assigned to the Contractor's Representative in the Subcontract and which are
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: expressly conferred on the Contractor's Representative by the Contractor in writing
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: from time to time.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (b) The Contractor's Representative shall have no authority to amend the Subcontract.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Contractor's Representative may exercise the authority attributable to the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Contractor's Representative as specified in the Subcontract or as conferred on the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Contractor's Representative by the Contractor in writing from time to time.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (d) The Contractor undertakes not to impose further constraints on the Contractor's
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Representative's authority without prior notice to the Subcontractor.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (e) Notwithstanding any other provision of the Subcontract:
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (i) the Contractor's Representative has no authority to relieve either Party of any
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: duties, obligations or responsibilities under the Subcontract; and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (ii) any approval, review, check, certificate, consent, examination, inspection,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: instruction, notice, proposal, request, test, or similar act by the Contractor's
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Representative (including absence of disapproval or approval, review, check,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: certificate, consent, examination, inspection, instruction, notice, proposal,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: request, test, or similar act by the Contractor's Representative) does not
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: relieve the Subcontractor from any responsibility it has under the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontract, including responsibility for errors, omissions, discrepancies and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: non-compliances.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) Subject to the Contractor's approval, the Contractor's Representative may from time
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: to time assign duties and delegate authority to assistants, and may also revoke such
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: assignment or delegation. These assistants may include a resident engineer, and/or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: independent inspectors appointed to inspect and/or test items of Plant and/or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Materials. The assignment, delegation or revocation shall be in writing and shall not
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: take effect until copies have been received by both Parties. However, unless
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: otherwise agreed by both Parties, the Contractor's Representative shall not delegate
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the authority to determine any matter in accordance with Clause 3.9 (Determinations).
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (b) Assistants shall be suitably qualified persons, who are competent to carry out these
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: duties and exercise this authority, and who are flugent in the language for
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: communications defined in Clause 1.4 Lawan
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: anguage).

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: performance of the balance of its obligations under the Subcontract.

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: provided in Annexure 12 (Form of Advance Payment Security) in the amounts and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: currencies stated in the Subcontract Particulars.

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor's Representative
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Subcontractor shall at all times have a Subcontractor's Representative and the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor shall give its Subcontractor's Representative all authority necessary to
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: act on the Subcontractor's behalf under the Subcontract.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (b) Unless the Subcontractor's Representative is named in the Subcontract, the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor shall, prior to the Commencement Date, submit to the Contractor's
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Representative for consent the name and particulars of the person the Subcontractor
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: proposes to appoint as Subcontractor's Representative. If consent is withheld or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: subsequently revoked, or if the appointed person fails to act as Subcontractor's
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Representative, the Subcontractor shall similarly submit the name and particulars of
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: another suitable person for such appointment.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (c) The Subcontractor shall not, without the prior consent of the Contractor's
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Representative, revoke the appointment of the Subcontractor's Representative or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: appoint a replacement.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (d) The whole time of the Subcontractor's Representative shall be given to directing the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor's performance of the Subcontract. If the Subcontractor's
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Representative is to be temporarily absent from the Site during the design (to the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: extent required by the Subcontract), execution and completion of the Works for a
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: period in excess of twenty (20) consecutive days, a suitable replacement person shall
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: be appointed, subject to the Contractor's Representative's prior consent, and the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Contractor's Representative shall be notified accordingly.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (e) The Subcontractor's Representative shall, on behalf of the Subcontractor, receive
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: instructions under Clause 3.7 (Instructions of the Contractor's Representative).
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (f) The Subcontractor's Representative may delegate any powers, functions and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: authority to any competent person, and may at any time revoke the delegation. Any
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: delegation or revocation shall not take effect until the Contractor's Representative has
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: received prior notice signed by the Subcontractor's Representative, naming the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: person and specifying the powers, functions and authority being delegated or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: revoked.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (g) The Subcontractor's Representative and all these persons shall be fluent in the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: language for communications defined in Clause 1.4 (Law and Language).

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the Subcontractor shall amend the subcontract and resubmit it to the Contractor.

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: proposed subcontract.

Text.Text: 7. Staff and Labour
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 7.1 Engagement of Staff and Labour
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Subcontractor shall make arrangements for the engagement of all staff and labour, local
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: or otherwise, and for their payment, housing, feeding and transport in compliance with all
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: applicable Laws.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 7.2 Persons in the Service of Contractor
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Subcontractor shall not recruit, or attempt to recruit, staff and labour from amongst the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Employer's and / or Contractor's Personnel.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 7.3 Labour Laws
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) The Subcontractor shall comply with all the relevant labour Laws applicable to the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor's Personnel, including Laws relating to their employment, health,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: safety, welfare, immigration and emigration, and shall allow them all their legal rights.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (b) The Subcontractor shall require its employees to obey all applicable Laws, including
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: those concerning safety at work.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 7.4 Working Hours
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) Subject to applicable Laws, no work shall be carried out on the Site on locally
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: recognised days of rest unless the work is unavoidable, or necessary for the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: protection of life or property or for the safety of the Works, in which case the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor shall immediately advise the Contractor's Representative.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (b) Where the Subcontractor carries out work in the vicinity of any residential area
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: outside of the normal working hours stated in the Subcontract Particulars, the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor shall adopt, where necessary, the use of quiet construction equipment
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: and/or shall employ the quietest practicable working methods.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 7.5 Facilities for Staff and Labour
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) The Subcontractor shall provide and maintain all necessary accommodation and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: welfare facilities for the Subcontractor's Personnel.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (b) The Subcontractor shall not permit any of the Subcontractor's Personnel to maintain
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: any temporary or permanent living quarters within the structures forming part of the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Permanent Works.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 7.6 Health and Safety
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) The Subcontractor shall at all times take all precautions to maintain the health and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 17) with all applicable health and safety Laws and the requirements of all Authorities.

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Personnel, and that suitable arrangements are made for all necessary welfare and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: hygiene requirements and for the prevention of epidemics.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: for maintaining safety and protection against accidents, regular safety inspections,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: hazard identification and risk assessments.

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: instruction, corrective action request process or a suspension of the Works.

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: compliance. Where the issue is not rectified in the defined timescale the next level of
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: action will be taken up to and including suspension of the Works.

Text.Text: and completion of the Works.

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Subcontractor shall, in all dealings with Subcontractor's Personnel, have due regard to all
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: recognised festivals, days of rest and religious or other customs. The Subcontractor shall not
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: be entitled to any extension of the Time for Completion, any modification to the programme
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: under Clause 9.3 (Programme), and/or any adjustment to the Subcontract price or any
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Termination).

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Subcontractor shall not import, sell, give, barter or otherwise allow the consumption of, or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: dispose of, any alcoholic liquor or drugs, or permit or suffer any such importation, sale, gift,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: barter or disposal by any Sub-Subcontractors or Subcontractor Personnel.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 7.15 Epidemics / Pandemics
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: In the event of any outbreak of illness of an epidemic or pandemic nature, the Subcontractor
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: shall comply with and carry out such regulations, reporting procedures, orders and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: requirements as may be made by any Authority for the purpose of dealing with and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: overcoming the same.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Sanitary Facilities
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Subcontractor shall provide and maintain sanitary facilities for the use of
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor's Personnel at such places around the Site as shall be approved by
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the Contractor's Representative and the Authorities and shall cause all
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractor's Personnel to use such facilities.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Subcontractor will not participate in and shall not allow its agents, employees or Sub-
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontractors or any of their agents or employees participate in any political or quasi
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: political activities while they are resident in or visiting the United Arab Emirates.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: manufacture of Materials, and all other design (to the extent required by the

Text.Text: 8.4 Testing

Text.Text: (a) This Clause 8.4 (Testing) shall apply to all tests specified in the Subcontract. All tests

Text.Text: Variations and Adjustments
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 13.1 Right to Vary
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) The Contractor or the Contractor's Representative may, at any time prior to issuing
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the Taking-Over Certificate for the Works or a Separable Portion, either:
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (i) issue written instructions requiring the implementation of a Variation with
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: immediate effect (Variation Order); or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (ii)
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: request the Subcontractor to submit a proposal for the implementation of a
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: proposed Variation.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (b) The Subcontractor shall execute and be bound by each Variation Order.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Each of the following may constitute a Variation:
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (i) the Contractor changes the Design Documents which leads to the changes in
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the Works;
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (ii) changes to the quantities of any item of work included in the Subcontract
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (however, such changes do not necessarily constitute a Variation);
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (iii) changes to the quality and other characteristics of any item of work;
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (iv) changes to the levels, positions and/or dimensions of any part of the Works;
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: omission of any part of the Works, which the Contractor may carry out itself
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 17.6 Limitation of Liability
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) The Subcontractor's liability to the Contractor under, or arising out of, this Subcontract
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontract Particulars, provided that such limitation shall not in any case apply:
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (i) under Clause 17.5 (Intellectual Property Rights);
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: bodily injury, sickness, disease or death, of any person;
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (iii) to any liability for Prohibited Acts;
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: expressly impose a greater liability; or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: in the event of the Subcontractor's fraud, negligence, wilful misconduct or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: illegal or unlawful acts.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Parties agree that the Subcontractor's limitation of liability in Clause 17.6(a) is
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: reasonable and has been negotiated in good faith and such limitation of liability is
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: intended by the Parties to be enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by applicable
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Law.

Text.Text: (c) The Parties agree that if any part or all of this Clause 17.6 (Limitation of Liability) is
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (a) In this Clause 19 (Force Majeure), "Force Majeure" means any Contractor's Risk

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 19.2 Notice of Force Majeure
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: If a Party is or will be prevented from performing all of its obligations under the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontract by Force Majeure, then it shall give notice to the other Party of the event
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: or circumstances constituting the Force Majeure and shall specify the obligations, the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: after the Party became aware, (or should have become aware), of the relevant event
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: or circumstance constituting Force Majeure.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Party shall, having given notice, be excused performance of such obligations for
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: so long as such Force Majeure prevents it from performing them.

Text.Label: Text

Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: dispute or difference. Each Party shall use reasonable endeavours to settle the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: dispute or difference at such meeting.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Unless settled amicably within such twenty (20) day period, and unless otherwise
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: agreed by both Parties, either Party shall be entitled to escalate a dispute to senior
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: members of each Party's organisation (who has authority to settle the dispute) by
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: giving notice to the other Party with reference to this Clause 20.3 (Amicable
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Settlement). Each Party shall use reasonable endeavours to agree on a time and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: venue for such discussion to take place and shall procure that a senior member of
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: that Party's organisation attends the discussion.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 20.4 Arbitration
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Unless settled amicably within forty (40) days of the notice of dispute under Clause 20.3
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (Amicable Settlement) the dispute shall be referred to and finally resolved by arbitration under
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the DIFC-LCIA Rules, which are deemed to be incorporated by reference into this Clause
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 20.4 (Arbitration). For any such arbitration:
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the number of arbitrators shall be three, one nominated by each Party and the two
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: appointed arbitrators shall jointly nominate the third;
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (b) the seat, or legal place, of arbitration shall be the Dubai International Financial Centre
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: in Dubai, United Arab Emirates; and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the language to be used in the arbitral proceedings shall be English.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Miscellaneous Provisions
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.1 Warranties as to capacity
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Contractor warrants that it has the power to execute, deliver and perform its
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: obligations under the Subcontract and all necessary corporate and other action has
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: been taken to authorise that execution, delivery and performance.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (b) The Subcontractor warrants that:
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: it has the power to execute, deliver and perform its obligations under the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontract and all necessary corporate and other action has been taken to
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: authorise that execution, delivery and performance;
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: it has obtained (or will obtain) from all relevant Authorities all licences,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (ii)
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: permissions and consents required in order for it to execute the Works and to
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: otherwise perform all of its obligations under the Subcontract; and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (iii) it has the information technology, capability, experience, management
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: expertise, financial resources, equipment, staff and other facilities necessarily
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: required to execute the Works in a competent and expeditious manner and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: otherwise in accordance with the Subcontract.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Severability
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The subject matter of the Subcontract is comprised of separately specified parts and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: provisions, and any provision (or part thereof) or provisions within the Subcontract which is (or
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: are) determined by a court or other competent Authority to be illegal, invalid or unenforceable
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: is (or are) severed to the extent of the illegality, invalidity or unenforceability, without affecting
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the remaining provision (or part thereof) or provisions of the Subcontract.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Counterparts
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Subcontract may be executed in any number of counterparts, all of which when taken
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: together constitute the one and the same instrument.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.4 Independent Subcontractor
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Subcontractor is an independent contractor performing the Subcontract. The Subcontract
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: does not create any partnership, joint venture or othen jeinte relationship between the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Contractor and the Subcontractor. Neither Party power or authority to enter into
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: any agreement or commitment or act on behalf Other Party.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.5 Privity
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: No provision of the Subcontract is intended to or does confer upon any third party (including
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: any Sub-Subcontractor) any implied benefit or right enforceable at the option of the third party
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: against the Contractor.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.6 Waiver
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: None of the terms, provisions or conditions of the Subcontract are considered waived
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: by the Contractor unless a waiver is given in writing by the Contractor.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Any waiver of the Contractor's rights, powers or remedies under the Subcontract
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: must be dated and signed by an authorised representative of the Contractor granting
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: such waiver, and must specify the right and the extent to which it is being waived.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.7 Exercise of Rights
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Parties agree that the exercise of a right by either Party under or in connection with the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Subcontract is deemed to have been exercised:
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: in a manner consistent with the requirements of good faith as required by Article 246
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the Code; and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (b) lawfully for the purposes of Article 106 of the Code.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.8 Imports and Customs
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: In connection with the performance of the Subcontract, the Subcontractor acknowledges that
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the imports and customs Law and regulations of the United Arab Emirates apply to the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: furnishings and shipments of any products and components thereof to the United Arab
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Emirates. The Subcontractor specifically acknowledges that the aforementioned import and
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: custom Laws and regulations of United Arab Emirates prohibit, among other things, the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: importation into the United Arab Emirates of certain products and components.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.9 Rights cumulative
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The rights, remedies and powers of each Party under or in connection with the Subcontract
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: are in addition to any rights, remedies and powers provided by Law.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.10 No variation
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Subcontract may not be varied except in writing signed by a duly authorised
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: representative of each of the Parties.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.11 Costs
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: Save as otherwise expressly provided under this Subcontract, each Party shall pay its own
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: costs and expenses (including the fees and expenses of its agents, representatives, advisors,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: counsel and accountants) necessary for the negotiation, preparation, execution, delivery,
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: performance of and compliance with this Subcontract.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.12 Further Documentation
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The Parties agree to execute any documents and to take any further steps as may be
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: reasonably necessary in order to implement and give full effect to the Subcontract.
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 21.13 Obligations continuing
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: The warranty obligations, confidentiality obligations and other obligations or liabilities, which
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: by their own terms survive the expiration or termination of this Subcontract, do not cease on
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: the completion, expiry or termination of this Subcontract. In addition, the provisions in Clauses
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: 15 (Termination by ), 16 (Suspension and Termination by ), 17 (Risk and Responsibility), 20
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: (Claims and Dispute Resolution) and 21 (Miscellaneous Provisions) shall survive the
Text.Label: Text

Text.Text: expiration or termination of this Subcontract.
